chapter.title: Component descriptors
chapter.para: A component descriptor file describes the properties of a component. The descriptor is used by a controller component to find out about the service &url; of the component, its type and any other information that the component descriptor defines.

Component descriptors files should normally be bundled together with the rest of a component's distribution In &carrot;'s &cvs;, however, there is a designated folder for all component descriptors (see ). During a global build process, component descriptors from that directory automatically copied to the controller component and used at runtime.
The structure of a component descriptor file is defined by an &xml; schema, see example below.

A typical component descriptor for a remote &http; &post; service must provide an identification string (assigned by &carrot; &cvs; maintainer), its type and the service's &url;.
